data.title: CIG Shanghai Unit Signs RMB63.8 Million Connected Long-Term Lease in Zhejiang
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

CIG Shanghai Co., Ltd. Class H ( (HK:6166) ) just unveiled an update.

CIG Shanghai’s key subsidiary CIG Zhejiang Telecommunication Equipment has entered into a long‑term lease with Jiashan Zhongxin Industrial Development Investment for an industrial, office, and warehousing facility in Jiashan, Zhejiang, covering about 88,815 square meters. The lease runs from April 1, 2026 to December 31, 2035, with the occupied area from 2031 determined by actual use by the lessee.

Because Jiashan Zhongxin holds around 33.33% of CIG Zhejiang, the arrangement is classified as a connected transaction under Hong Kong listing rules, requiring disclosure but no independent shareholder approval. The group will recognize right‑of‑use assets of about RMB63.8 million for this one‑off connected lease, signaling a sizable, long‑term commitment to production and logistics capacity while keeping regulatory compliance obligations relatively light.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:6166) stock is a Hold with a HK$86.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on CIG Shanghai Co., Ltd. Class H stock, see the HK:6166 Stock Forecast page.

More about CIG Shanghai Co., Ltd. Class H

CIG Shanghai Co., Ltd. is a telecommunications equipment company operating through subsidiaries such as CIG Zhejiang Telecommunication Equipment Co., Ltd. The group focuses on manufacturing and related industrial, office, and warehousing activities to support its telecom equipment business in mainland China and listed operations in Hong Kong.

Average Trading Volume: 2,247,752

Current Market Cap: HK$32.88B

data.title: China Construction Bank President Zhang Yi Takes on Dual Role as Chief Compliance Officer
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

China Construction Bank ( (HK:0939) ) has provided an update.

China Construction Bank has appointed its president, Zhang Yi, to concurrently serve as chief compliance officer with effect from 27 February 2026, following approval by the board of directors. The move consolidates executive leadership and compliance oversight under a single senior figure, underscoring the bank’s focus on regulatory adherence and governance as it operates in increasingly stringent domestic and international supervisory environments.

The board also confirmed the current composition of its executive, non-executive and independent non-executive directors, signaling continuity in its overall governance structure. For investors and regulators, the dual role for Zhang Yi may streamline decision-making on compliance matters while highlighting the strategic weight the bank assigns to risk management and regulatory conformity across its large, systemically important franchise.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0939) stock is a Buy with a HK$9.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on China Construction Bank stock, see the HK:0939 Stock Forecast page.

More about China Construction Bank

China Construction Bank Corporation is one of China’s largest state-owned commercial banks, operating across corporate and retail banking, treasury operations and international financial services. Listed in Hong Kong under stock code 00939, it plays a systemically important role in the mainland and offshore banking markets, serving individuals, enterprises and public sector clients.

data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions

The latest announcement is out from China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co ( (HK:2601) ).

China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co., Ltd. has established a nomination and remuneration committee of its board to enhance its governance structure and formalize the administration of director and senior management appointments and pay. The committee is mandated to design performance appraisal criteria, determine and review compensation packages, oversee share incentive and employee stock ownership plans, and make recommendations on the nomination, appointment, and removal of directors and senior executives.

The committee will be composed of more than three non-executive directors, with a majority being independent and at least one member possessing strong experience in talent identification and remuneration management, as well as gender diversity requirements. It operates under delegated authority from the board, with members elected by the board, chaired by an independent director, and serving terms aligned with the directors’ tenure, aiming to improve transparency, accountability, and alignment of leadership incentives with company objectives.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:2601) stock is a Buy with a HK$46.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co stock, see the HK:2601 Stock Forecast page.

The company focuses on insurance and financial services and is strengthening its corporate governance practices for directors and senior management in line with banking and insurance governance standards.

data.title: China Pacific Insurance Sets Up Board Committee to Tighten Audit and Related-Party Oversight
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co ( (HK:2601) ) has shared an announcement.

China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co., Ltd. has established an Audit and Related Party Transaction Control Committee under its board to strengthen corporate governance, enhance pre-audit and professional audit functions, and reinforce internal supervision. The committee is mandated to oversee financial reporting and disclosure, supervise internal and external audits, monitor the company’s business operations and internal control systems, and assume certain supervisory powers typically vested in a board of supervisors.

The committee will also be responsible for managing, reviewing and controlling risks associated with related party transactions, operating under authorization from and reporting to the board. It will comprise at least three non-management directors, with a majority being independent non-executive directors possessing expertise in finance, auditing, accounting, law or related fields, and will be chaired by an independent director with an accounting background, with safeguards such as cooling-off periods for former audit firm partners to ensure independence.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:2601) stock is a Buy with a HK$46.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co stock, see the HK:2601 Stock Forecast page.

More about China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co

China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co., Ltd. is a leading Chinese insurance group operating under the regulatory frameworks for banking and insurance institutions. The company focuses on providing insurance and related financial services, with its shares listed in Hong Kong, and adheres to corporate governance codes applicable to listed insurers and financial groups.

data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions

An announcement from Innovax Holdings Limited ( (HK:2680) ) is now available.

Innovax Holdings Limited and its potential acquirer, Mr. Wang Tingfa, have issued a monthly update on a proposed unconditional mandatory cash offer for all Innovax shares not already owned by Wang and his concert parties. The transaction is tied to a sale and purchase agreement and a related disposal that also constitutes a connected transaction and special deal under Hong Kong listing rules.

The offer remains contingent on completion of the underlying share sale, including Securities and Futures Commission approval for Wang or any new substantial shareholder to become a substantial shareholder of each regulated group company. The parties confirmed that all conditions remain unsatisfied, with the offeror still responding to SFC requisitions, and said further monthly updates and a combined composite document will be issued, while cautioning shareholders not to take a view on the offer until full documentation and independent advice are available.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:2680) stock is a Hold with a HK$12.50 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Innovax Holdings Limited stock, see the HK:2680 Stock Forecast page.

More about Innovax Holdings Limited

Innovax Holdings Limited is a Hong Kong-listed company incorporated in the Cayman Islands, operating in the financial services sector through regulated group companies overseen by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong. Its shareholder base and control structure are subject to regulatory approvals when substantial shareholdings change, reflecting its role in a tightly supervised market environment.

data.title: Cheuk Nang Stays Cautious but Confident as Key Property Markets Stabilise
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

An announcement from Cheuk Nang (Holdings) Limited ( (HK:0131) ) is now available.

Cheuk Nang (Holdings) Limited reported its interim results for the six months ended 31 December 2025, highlighting a mixed but gradually stabilising landscape across its core real estate markets in Greater China and Southeast Asia. The company noted that Hong Kong’s residential market is showing renewed strength, with improved transaction volumes, lower mortgage rates, and recovering prime prices, while Macau and Kuala Lumpur continue to benefit from tourism recovery, solid macro fundamentals, and relatively attractive property valuations.

In Mainland China, the group remains cautious as the sector faces structural headwinds and compressed margins, even as price declines moderate and sentiment improves in tier-one cities like Hangzhou and Shenzhen. Management is prioritising disciplined execution, cost control, and quality-focused development, including asset enhancement at its flagship Hong Kong projects, positioning the company to capture demand for well-located, higher-quality residential offerings despite industry-wide pressure on profitability.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0131) stock is a Hold with a HK$1.50 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Cheuk Nang (Holdings) Limited stock, see the HK:0131 Stock Forecast page.

More about Cheuk Nang (Holdings) Limited

Cheuk Nang (Holdings) Limited is a Hong Kong–incorporated property developer focused primarily on residential real estate projects. The group’s portfolio spans key Asian markets including Hong Kong, Mainland China cities such as Hangzhou and Shenzhen, Macau, and Kuala Lumpur, targeting mid to high-end buyers in economically resilient urban clusters.

Parkson Retail Group Limited has announced a change in key corporate governance roles, with company secretary and authorised representative Ms. Yuen Wing Yan Winnie set to resign, along with her role as Hong Kong process agent, effective 1 March 2026. data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Beijing Urban Construction Design & Development Grp Co., Ltd Class H ( (HK:1599) ) just unveiled an announcement.

Beijing Urban Construction Design & Development Group Co., Limited, a PRC-based urban construction design and development company listed in Hong Kong, has a share capital structure comprising 71.24% domestic shares and 28.76% H shares. Of the H shares, 23.70% are held by public investors, leaving the company below the Hong Kong Stock Exchange’s minimum public float requirement of 25 percent.

The board acknowledges the ongoing shortfall in public float and is prioritizing remedial measures, chiefly by engaging minority domestic shareholders to convert their holdings into H shares via a full-circulation program. The company has appointed legal advisers, secured verbal consent from some shareholders, plans to apply to the China Securities Regulatory Commission once internal procedures are complete, expects to finish full circulation within 12 months of application, and will issue monthly updates to keep investors informed on progress.

CLP Holdings ( (HK:0002) ) has issued an announcement.

CLP Holdings has announced that independent non-executive director Christina Gaw will retire from the board and the Sustainability Committee at the conclusion of its 2026 annual general meeting, after serving two full terms since joining in 2020 and choosing not to seek re-election. The board expressed appreciation for her contributions and confirmed there are no disagreements or issues requiring shareholder attention in connection with her departure.

The company will appoint veteran corporate lawyer and governance specialist Peter Wilhelm Hubert Brien as an independent non-executive director and a member of its Finance & General, Audit & Risk, and Sustainability Committees with effect from 27 February 2026, strengthening its board with his extensive experience at Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing and in capital markets regulation. CLP emphasised that Brien meets independence requirements, has no conflicting interests or relationships with major stakeholders, and will receive standard director and committee fees, underscoring a continued focus on strong governance and regulatory compliance.

data.title: Wecon Halts Trading Ahead of Takeovers Code Announcement
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Wecon Holdings Ltd. ( (HK:1793) ) has issued an announcement.

Wecon Holdings Limited has requested a halt in trading of its shares on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong, effective from 9:00 a.m. on 27 February 2026. The company cited the pending release of an announcement related to the Code on Takeovers and Mergers, indicating that the forthcoming information qualifies as inside information.

The move signals that a potential corporate transaction or change of control may be under consideration, which could have material implications for shareholders and the company’s future strategic direction. Investors are likely to scrutinize the upcoming announcement for clarity on valuation, governance and possible shifts in ownership structure that may affect Wecon’s market positioning and regulatory obligations.

The latest announcement is out from Sitoy Group Holdings Limited ( (HK:1023) ).

Sitoy Group Holdings Limited has declared an interim ordinary dividend of HKD 0.02 per share for the six months ended 31 December 2025, for the financial year ending 30 June 2026. The move signals continued commitment to shareholder returns and reflects the board’s confidence in the group’s financial position and cash generation.

The shares will trade ex-dividend on 26 March 2026, with the record date set for 2 April 2026 and payment scheduled for 27 April 2026 in Hong Kong dollars. The timetable gives investors clear visibility on dividend entitlement and may support trading liquidity around the ex-dividend and record dates, while providing existing shareholders with a defined income stream in the current period.
